summary: Artwork gallery app "Z'art" where an admin can upload artworks with title/description/GBP price, view them in a gallery, tap to view full display, and automatically resize oversized images on upload.
architectural_notes: Store artwork metadata: title, description, price (GBP) alongside image asset.
Implement automatic image resizing/compression during upload to handle oversized images.
Split frontend routes/views: public gallery browsing vs admin-only upload page; ensure upload page is only accessible/visible to admin users.

existing_features.title: Set the application name to "Z'art" and reflect it consistently in the UI (header/title) and any app metadata used by the frontend.

Implement frontend gallery browsing: display artworks in a responsive grid with thumbnail/preview, title, and GBP price. When a user taps/clicks an artwork card, open a full artwork view that shows the image fully along with title, description, and formatted GBP price.

Implement an admin-only upload workflow in the frontend: an upload form for title, description, GBP price input, and image file selection; show this UI only when the authenticated user is the admin (as determined by the backend).

Automatically resize oversized images on the client before upload: when an admin selects an image larger than a defined maximum dimension and/or file size, resize it (preserving aspect ratio) and compress it to a reasonable JPEG/WEBP quality before sending to the backend.

Apply a cohesive visual theme suitable for an artwork gallery (non-blue/non-purple primary palette), including typography, spacing, and card/detail view styling, and use it consistently across gallery, detail view, and admin upload UI.
Generate required static brand images and render them in the UI from frontend static assets (do not serve generated images through the backend).
Split the admin artwork upload UI into a dedicated upload page/view, so the gallery view no longer contains the upload form.
Add in-app navigation to access the separate Upload page and back to Gallery, showing the Upload navigation entry only to authenticated admins; prevent non-admin users from accessing the Upload page.

new_feature_requests.summary: Admin role: make the user an admin
Artwork uploads include title, description, and price in GBP
Gallery view: display uploaded artworks and open full display when tapped
Automatically resize oversized images on upload

Implement admin identification so that the first authenticated Internet Identity principal becomes the admin automatically, and persist this admin principal in stable backend state. Provide a backend method to query whether the caller is admin.

Create backend CRUD endpoints for artworks with the following fields: id, title, description, price in GBP (stored as integer minor units/pence), image content, image content type, created timestamp, and owner/uploader principal. Restrict creation (upload) to admin callers.
Separate the admin artwork uploading page from the public gallery view (dedicated upload route/page rather than combined UI)
